reviews.review_text: This game will help you learn percentages. You think that's a joke don't you? Well it's not. Your goal in this game is to kill a certain percentage of hostiles. There are a certain number of hostiles on the level, for example 49. You may have to kill 80% of hostiles. Once you kill 40 of the 49 hostiles, you are at about 80 or 81 percent, and you are allowed to advance to the next level.  10/10 would recommend to school teachers to help teach percentages

First of all I just wanted to start by saying I played Postal 2 before this one, but since Postal was on sale i decided to see how all started... I have to say that i liked this old school game and reminded me of the 1st GTA.  + Funny. (Check some advertise in game and you will know what I mean) xD + Kill everything. + Ostrich! (You will know what I mean when you play it). + Arcade Style.  - No Plot. - Got stuck on 1st Level because i didn't know where to go. (You have to press F1 when the objective is complete) - Always the same objective. (Kill XX% of enemies). - It's annoying when you don't want to kill civilians and yet they just 'suicide' running to you while you are trying to shoot enemies xD (Just not killing civilians for achievement...) - Rocket Launcher dudes super annoying when you get hit once and while getting up get hit again and again... till you die. (You can crouch but only after you get up).  The presence of a moving van on the first level suggests that the character has been evicted from his home and is 'going postal', but there is no story evolution during the game, you just kill as much as you want... However there are some quotes from some kind of diary.  Don't think it's conected to Postal 2, but I had fun playing.  Anyway... Remember this is just my opinion, some of my (+) can be a (-) to you and viceversa. It depends from player to player. Also I'm sorry for my English. (I'm Portuguese). Hope my review was helpful to you! :D

After coming home from work to find his house repossessed, the character known as Postal Dude, decides that everyone is out to get him and goes Postal. The game gets under way with Postal Dude standing outside his home, unable to get inside but armed to the teeth nevertheless. You must make use of the twelve weapons at your disposal in order to dispatch anything with a pulse. Men, women, children and neighbor dog. 16 levels with given percentage of the hostiles. There are no magic power ups, no special abilities. It's just you, your arsenal, and the occasional Kevlar vest or first-aid kit.  Go get them.

Postal was essentially the game to get if you wanted a straight-up murder simulator, the only objective each level is to gun down, burn, or blow up anything that moves. Unlike its sequels, the cynical humor and urination takes a backseat for a more dark, morbid and unsettling tone. The game is exactly as it was back in '97 just with a bit of tweaking to run on modern systems, so don't be all too mortified by the chunky visuals and horrendous aiming (the mouse AFAIK only rotates Postal Dude, it does not actually allow you to point and aim).  I'd mainly reccomend Postal to those who played the game back in the day, curious about the grim and gritty beginnings of the Postal, or take enjoyment in playing archaic-as-hell PC games like I am.

This Game stars the POSTAL Dude, a troubled young man who goes insane after getting evicted from his home and decides to fight his way through his Home of 'Paradise'. The Police and gangs of the City aren't much better than him, they attack the Dude before he even opens fire and sometimes end up killing innocent civilians, there truly is no hero in this story. In terms of Gameplay everything takes place in either a top down or isometric perspective (depending on the Level) with the Dude having to use a bunch of different Weapons including Shotguns, Machine Guns, Napalm Launchers and more to take out a percentage of armed 'hostiles' on the Level with civilians being optional targets. After the goal is met the player simply presses the F1 key and moves on until all the Levels are completed. The Gameplay is fun but gets rather boring after a while especially since the enemies have a lot of Health. The controls also feel stiff and awkward due to the fact that the Dude will respond to the pressing of movement keys differently depending on the direction he is facing, this the Game even less fun to play than it already was and it's honestly not worth getting anymore since the remake (POSTAL Redux) has been out for a while now, get that instead!

Postal is absolutely atrocious. The game feels incredibly clunky and the combat feels extremely archaic. While I tried to see the good in the game, there was barely anything worth buying the game for. The very fact that the player has to press a button to progress to the next level just shows how outdated the game is. I spent a couple of minutes in the first level wondering why I couldn't proceed to the next level. Hilariously enough, all it took was to press the F1 button. Overall, Postal has almost no redeeming value to it and you'd be better off playing almost any other isometric shooter game.

Postal 1 is more fun than it may seem, but the reasons for that are quite vague.  The game is an isometric shooter with buggy hand drawn environment, extremely janky controls and poor semi-scripted AI.   That said, the weapon variety is rich and the maps are interesting. Most importantly, it actually feels fun to 'outsmart' the dumb AI by shooting enemies that are stuck in the scenery or cannot see you and to trick them into blowing up and burning each other. It's a bit weird thing to say, but, as it turns out, the game's biggest appeal lies in its shortcomings.  Despite the fun factor, I would not recommend the game to myself, had I not played it a long time ago. The reason for this is that I'm not feeling comfortable with such level of violence anymore. I'm OK with some cartoony murder of faceless low-poly clones, but when the police ladies you have to kill start screaming in agony for half a minute and the game has a dedicated button for putting dying people out of their misery, that's a bit over the line for me.  On top of this, the game crashes quite frequently, which may be very frustrating when it happens after nearly completing a level. I don't recall this being a problem with the original game, so there must be something wrong with the revamped Steam version.  If the excessive violence, low resolution and general instability do not turn you off, however, you may have some good fun with the game, especially on the hardest difficulty (which is really not that hard, once you get used to the controls and the pacing).

(English) It is the unlimited action, where you can just wantonly kill everyone. Postal is an isometric 3D shooter, although some of the levels represented by the top view. The game had a fairly simple point — in the mind of the protagonist of the game, called Postal Dude ( a Crazy dude), begins to speak a voice. The guy is crazy and one fine winter day goes out and starts forbidding to cut the neighbors came out on the porch to get some fresh air, janitors, clearing the snow in the yards, salesmen pushing the next irons Turbonegro, police, happily zdorovaemsya with all the counter — in General, anything that can walk and talk. Throughout the action, the main character visits different locations of the city and commit a massacre over the counter. In the case that the position is hopeless, the main character has the ability to shoot himself in the head. The game was banned for sale in all civilized countries of the world. Of course, she was the wildest popular in the most spiritual country in the world — Russia.  (Русский) Это самый беспредельный экшен, где можно просто беспричинно убивать всех подряд. Postal представляет собой изометрический 3D-шутер, хотя некоторые уровни представлены видом сверху. Игра имела довольно простую суть — в голове главного героя игры, называемого Postal Dude ( Поехавший чувак), начинает говорить голос. Парень сходит с ума и в один прекрасный зимний день выходит на улицу и начинает невозбранно выпиливать соседей, вышедших на крыльцо подышать свежим воздухом, дворников, расчищающих снег во дворах, коммивояжеров, толкающих очередные утюги с турбонагревом, полицию, радостно здоровающуюся со всеми встречными — в общем все, что умеет ходить и говорить. На протяжении всего действа, главный герой посещает разные локации города и учиняет расправу всем встречным. В случае, если положение безвыходное, главный герой имеет возможность выстрелить себе в голову. Игра была запрещена к продаже во всех цивилизованных странах мира. Разумеется, она стала дичайше популярна в самой духовной стране мира — России.
